metadata.Title: CVE-2018-0202 on Ubuntu 14.04 ESM (trusty) - medium
metadata.Description:
clamscan in ClamAV before 0.99.4 contains a vulnerability that could allowan unauthenticated, remote attacker to cause a denial of service (DoS)condition on an affected device. The vulnerability is due to improper inputvalidation checking mechanisms when handling Portable Document Format(.pdf) files sent to an affected device. An unauthenticated, remoteattacker could exploit this vulnerability by sending a crafted .pdf file toan affected device. This action could cause an out-of-bounds read whenClamAV scans the malicious file, allowing the attacker to cause a DoScondition. This concerns pdf_parse_array and pdf_parse_string inlibclamav/pdfng.c. Cisco Bug IDs: CSCvh91380, CSCvh91400.

    Update Instructions:

    Run `sudo pro fix CVE-2018-0202` to fix the vulnerability. The problem can be corrected
    by updating your system to the following package versions:

clamav - 0.99.4+addedllvm-0ubuntu0.14.04.1
clamav-base - 0.99.4+addedllvm-0ubuntu0.14.04.1
clamav-daemon - 0.99.4+addedllvm-0ubuntu0.14.04.1
clamav-freshclam - 0.99.4+addedllvm-0ubuntu0.14.04.1
clamav-milter - 0.99.4+addedllvm-0ubuntu0.14.04.1
clamav-testfiles - 0.99.4+addedllvm-0ubuntu0.14.04.1
libclamav7 - 0.99.4+addedllvm-0ubuntu0.14.04.1
Available with Ubuntu Pro (Infra-only): https://ubuntu.com/pro

criterions.comment: clamav package in trusty/esm was vulnerable but has been fixed (note: '0.99.4+addedllvm-0ubuntu0.14.04.1').
